thread.title: West Ham join Burnley and Middlesbrough in £10million chase for Robert Snodgrass
thread.title_full: West Ham join Burnley and Middlesbrough in £10million chase for Robert Snodgrass

author: gsweet
title: West Ham join Burnley and Middlesbrough in £10million chase for Robert Snodgrass

organizations.name: crystal palace cris of death celta vigo

text:
Comments WEST HAM have joined Burnley and Middlesbrough in a three-way tug-of-war for Hull top scorer Robert Snodgrass. 
The Hammers are thought to have improved on Burnley’s £10million bid for the nine-goal former Norwich man while ‘Boro are waiting to see if their undisclosed offer has been accepted. PA:Press Association 3 Wanted man…Robert Snodgrass can join West Ham, Burnley or Middlesbrough 
The Tigers, who are 19th in the Premier League, rejected a bid from the Hammers earlier this month believed to be in the region of £6m. 
Keep up to date with ALL the HULL news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
It is now down to Scotland midfielder Snodgrass, 29, to decide where he wants to go. 
Hull head coach Marco Silva has stated he would like to keep Snodgrass at the KCOM. Related Stories NO MOUR CHANCES Jose Mourinho tells out-of-favour Anthony Martial he has blown his opportunity to nail down his Manchester United place WORK OF ART Arturo Vidal already learning English as Chelsea boss Antonio Conte launches £56m summer move SCISSOR RICK West Ham striker Andy Carroll suffering from WHIPLASH after scoring THAT goal against Crystal Palace CRIS OF DEATH Celta Vigo 2 Real Madrid 2 (agg 4-3): Cristiano Ronaldo misses from three yards as stuttering Los Blancos crash out of Copa del Rey Wayne is the Ron Wayne Rooney could have been bigger than Cristiano Ronaldo if he was more selfish, claims Rio Ferdinand 
The winger has been at Hull since 2014 after stints at Carrow Road and Leeds. 
Burnley are looking to add his firepower to Andre Gray’s seven goals. Getty Images Snodgrass has 12 goals for club and country this season Watch all the Premier League action in our Weekend round-up West Bromwich Albion FC The Scottish star previously played for Norwich and Leeds 
Snodgrass has actually fired 12 goals this season, including a hat-trick for his country. 
West Ham could soon have a free space in midfield if wantaway Dimitri Payet final makes his way back to Marseille. 
Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport's daily LIVE blog . 
Snodgrass's ability at set pieces would go a long way to making up for the Frenchman's absence while his pace on the counter attack is also very attractive to Hammers' boss Slaven Bilic.
